item.title: [DISTRELEC-4303] Loading time after log in
item.description:
Hi René, as discussed, we should really find a solution to optimize the loading time after login.
Could you please analyze the possibilities?
Thank you.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
@Florian

I've done a small test with my test account and the schweiz_test account.

With my account it takes aprox. 1 sec. display the home page after login.

With the schweiz_test account it takes aprox. 3-4 sec. display the home page after login.

Are there accounts which do take much longer?

1st time login: up to 7s
follow-up login: 3s

  • user to reproduce bad behavior on...
    • Q: User=schweiz_test Pass=123456
    • P: User=schweiz_test Pass=Distrelec14
  • Possible cause:
    • Slow performance (1st time only) of fetching the shopping lists

There are many ModelAttributes on the AbstractPageController.
But the "metaLists" (getDistShoppingListFacade().getMiniWishlists()) and "hasCompareProducts" (compareListFacade.getCompareList()) can take more than 2 seconds to evaluate, if not cached.

The Hybris cache for the flexibleSearch-Queries works quite well as shown in the example. The first call after changing the user, the language or something else, which causes the query not to lookup in the cache, takes very long.

The other examined method calls don't have a big influence...

*************************************************************
First call:

user: schweiz_test
method: shoppingListFacade.getMiniWishlists()
duration: 1.291 seconds
method: userFacade.getTitles()
duration: 0.001 seconds
method: compareListFacade.getCompareList()
duration: 0.812 seconds
method: storeSessionFacade.getAllLanguages()
duration: 0.003 seconds


*************************************************************
Second call:

user: schweiz_test
method: shoppingListFacade.getMiniWishlists()
duration: 0.009 seconds
method: userFacade.getTitles()
duration: 0
method: compareListFacade.getCompareList()
duration: 0.050 seconds
method: storeSessionFacade.getAllLanguages()
duration: 0.003 seconds

It seems the FlexibleSearch is not the problem as it is very fast even in an uncached state.
The problem seems the loading of the products while converting.

NamicsMiniWishlistConverter:

target.setUniqueId(source.getUniqueId());
target.setName(source.getName());
target.setTotalUnitCount(source.getEntries().size()); <-- Here it seems all products will be fetched

Flexible Search to get all required information:

SELECT {l.pk}, {l.uniqueId}, {l.name}, count(*)
FROM {Wishlist2 as l JOIN Wishlist2Entry as e ON {l.pk} = {e.wishlist}}
WHERE {l.user}=8801827127300
AND {l.listType}=8796112060507
GROUP BY {l.pk}, {l.uniqueId}, {l.name}
ORDER BY {l.name}

Retrieve the MiniWishlist directly over the FlexibleSearch without instantiating the Hybris-Models (see query in comment above).

On my local environment the execution time for the uncached case could be improved for shoppingListFacade.getMiniWishlists() from 0.283s to 0.029s and for compareListFacade.getCompareList() from 0.105s to 0.033s.

Also the cleanup code from DISTRELEC-3554 for merging more than one default list will only be executed if the whole list with all the products will be retrieved.
This code may also be moved into an interceptor, cleanup-job or a cleanup-script as it should not be part of a find-method and the ModelService-methods are very bad for the performance.
Even if this part of the code will only executed once, it was executed after the first login after creating more than one default list, which could also be a reason for extremly slow logins.

According to remo there is some more potential to for speed improvement.
Re-opening the ticket for evaluation.

During the first login the user-specific navigation will be loaded from the database. (see the cat2catrel sqls in the first login jdbc log), which takes on my local system a bit more than 1 second.

For the second login (even with another browser) there is no database query for the navigation.

The Optivo-Service initialization can also take several seconds on my local machine 

08 Aug 2014 10:32:39 DEBUG [hybrisHTTP30] [OptivoNewsletterService] currentBaseSiteUid [distrelec_CH]
08 Aug 2014 10:32:39 DEBUG [hybrisHTTP30] [OptivoNewsletterService] currentLanguageIsocode [de]
08 Aug 2014 10:32:39 DEBUG [hybrisHTTP30] [OptivoNewsletterService] property prefix [optivo.client.id.] -> id [54197771390]
08 Aug 2014 10:32:42 DEBUG [hybrisHTTP30] [OptivoNewsletterService] currentBaseSiteUid [distrelec_CH]
08 Aug 2014 10:32:42 DEBUG [hybrisHTTP30] [OptivoNewsletterService] currentLanguageIsocode [de]
08 Aug 2014 10:32:42 DEBUG [hybrisHTTP30] [OptivoNewsletterService] property prefix [optivo.recipientList.id.] -> id [54197771402]

OptivoNewsletterService.getSpecificNewsletterProfile(..) will be called for each login and there at least a new Optivo-Session will be initalized over a Webservice and after that a check if the user has a profile will also be done.

activated a Stopwatch-Aspect in distrelecfactfindersearch-spring.xml with a threshold of 0.5s.

On my local machine this aspect will be triggered each time for OptivoNewsletterService.getSegmentedNewsletterProfile(..)

Same for DEV:

13 Aug 2014 11:05:32 WARN  [hybrisHTTP32] [newsletter] com.namics.distrelec.b2b.core.service.newsletter.impl.OptivoNewsletterService - StopWatch 'execution(OptivoNewsletterService.getSegmentedNewsletterProfile(..))': running time (millis) = 1550
java.lang.String@69ed1e7f[
  value={r,e,m,o,.,l,e,h,m,a,n,n,@,n,a,m,i,c,s,.,c,o,m}
  hash=-553711288
]

==> 1550 millis

Now the question: Do we need the newsletter profile during the login?
Is it not possible to load this after e.g. clicking "my account" or entering the "user information" section?

  • Update newsletter status asynchronously

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4593] SEO - URL Duplications Issues - Between Manufacturer - 301 to add and db to clean
item.description:

  • CRITICAL UPDATE 27/07/14 : SEM/Emailing/Marketing :
    • All campaign that target manufacturer landing page lead to empty landing pages

Demands :

  • Removal of the wrong anchor and links on http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/ : NOK
  • For tracking purpose, the tracking suffix shouldn’t get lost during the redirections : NOK
  • EDIT : 05/08/14 : SAP manufacturer id force us to make a compromise on the manufacturer url behavior,
    we will have to redirect in http 301 all cropped manufacturer name url and their one original url to this pattern "http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/full_brand_name/sap_cropped_brand_name
    • Exemple :
      • http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux/aul :NOK
      • http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/aul -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux/aul : NOK
  • EDIT 28/08/14 : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer to fix

Checking process :

  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

comments.comment:

  • 301 redirect of the wrong manufacturer : NOK linked to https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-4597 issue N°7

=> Reopening of the issue

Live check 28/07/14 :

- 301 redirect of the wrong manufacturer : NOK

New evolution, all the good url (exemple http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux) are now providing an error "Manufacturer not found" and no content on the page.
As requested previously, we must keep the full naming structure for the manufacturer and redirect in http 301 the cropped named pages to the full named once.
Product content must appear on the full named manufacturer pages ASAP !

These are the manufacturers that are listed in the footer, but not available in the system:

===Start statistic of manufacturers===
Manufacturers listed in manufacturer page [1347]

Manufacturer [ban_boehler] does not exist.
Manufacturer [sony] does not exist.
Manufacturer [amprobe] does not exist.
Manufacturer [brother] does not exist.
===End statistic of manufacturers===

I've created the ticket DISTRELEC-4688 to change the content of the footer.

On the current version I cannot find any duplicated manufacturer.
Manufacturer Accuride only occurs once (/manufacturer/acu)

The manufacturer have been deduplicated, but only the bad one have been kept :

We just need :
1 - The content back on the /manufacturer/not-cropped-named (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)
2 - The links to the /manufacturer/not-cropped-named on the /manufacturer/ page (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)
3 - 301 redirect from /manufacturer/cropped-named to /manufacturer/not-cropped-named (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acc -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)

Live check :
NOK
Florian, for this i need the list of the list of the mapping between the "old" manufacturer code and the new one.
https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-4689

Here the description of the solution.

The old PIM manufacturer code is now deprecated (eg: for Bosch the manufacturer code was bosch)
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch
The new SAP manufacturer code is now used (eg: for Bosh the new manufacturer code is bsh)
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bsh

To make the maufacturer url SEO compliant we will add the manufacturer name to the url in that way: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/[manufacturer-name]/[manufacturer-code]
For Bosch the manufacturer url will look like this:
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
This URL will be exposed everywhere in the webshop as new canonical URL, in this way will be crawled.

Here the note about redirects:

  • OLD url will be redirected to the new CANONICAL url
    This is useful because the search engines still have the old urls
    Example: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch ----> www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
  • NEW url will be redirected to the new CANONICAL url
    This because internally the webshop will refer only to the new url
    Example: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bsh----> www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh

@francesco : Thx, for the details.
For the rewritten url, it's highly preferable to avoid capital letter.
Capital letter inside url just lead to side effect and maintenance problems in SEO and linking.
Exemple :
Bad : www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
Good : www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch/bsh

Implementation is done
What is missing is to finalize the apache redirects for old->new manufacturer codes.

Thank you Francesco, that's great !
